io.hekate.rpc

Class RpcServiceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.hekate.messaging.MessagingConfigBase<RpcServiceFactory>
      • io.hekate.rpc.RpcServiceFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceFactory<RpcService>

    public class RpcServiceFactory
extends MessagingConfigBase<RpcServiceFactory>
implements ServiceFactory<RpcService>
    Factory for RpcService.

    This class represents a configurable factory for RpcService. Instances of this class can be registered within the HekateBootstrap in order to customize options of the RpcService.

    For more details about the Remote Procedure Call API and its capabilities please see the documentation of the RpcService interface.

      • getWorkerThreads

        public int getWorkerThreads()
        Returns the worker thread pool size (see setWorkerThreads(int)).
        Returns:
        Worker thread pool size

      • setWorkerThreads

        public void setWorkerThreads(int workerThreads)
        Sets the worker thread pool size for RPCs execution.

        The thread pool of this size will be used by the RpcService to perform all RPCs executions and callbacks notification.

        If not directly specified then the number of available CPUs (see Runtime.availableProcessors()) will be used as the default value. If zero value is specified then all RPCs will be executed directly on NIO threads (see MessagingConfigBase.setNioThreads(int)).

        Parameters:
        workerThreads - Worker thread pool size.

      • withWorkerThreads

        public RpcServiceFactory withWorkerThreads(int workerThreads)
        Fluent-style version of setWorkerThreads(int).
        Parameters:
        workerThreads - Worker thread pool size.
        Returns:
